New Records: Germany became the first side in European Championship history to have two players aged 21 or under score for them in the same game.
Key Match Events: Julian Nagelsmann’s side was 3-0 up at half-time and a man to the good after Ryan Porteous was sent off for a horror tackle on Ilkay Gundogan.
Niclas Füllkrug scored a thumping effort in the second half.
Emre Can scored an injury-time goal.
Antonio Rudiger scored an own goal, giving Scotland a consolation goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Julian Nagelsmann emphasized the importance of the team over individual players, highlighting the unity and collective effort of the group.
Nagelsmann praised Toni Kroos for his experience and calmness, noting his significant contribution to the team.
Steve Clarke expressed disappointment in Scotland's performance, acknowledging that the team did not play to their standard and emphasizing the need to focus on the next two games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The new UEFA initiative to prevent players from approaching referees appeared to work well, with no yellow cards for dissent during the match.
Maximilian Mittelstadt's performance was highlighted as a significant contribution to Germany's success, showcasing his development and fit within Nagelsmann's system.
Others: Germany's next match is against Hungary on June 19, 2024.
Scotland's next match is against Switzerland on June 19, 2024.
